author: Special Correspondent
text:
NOVEL WAY:M.V. Karuppiah, Sholavandan MLA, floating on water in Corporation swimming pool in Madurai on Tuesday as part of Chief Minister Jayalalithaa’s 68th birthday celebrations.— Photo: S. James

M.V. Karuppiah, Sholavandan MLA, on Tuesday performed ‘jalapradakshanam’ by floating in the Madurai Corporation swimming pool praying for the long and healthy life of Chief Minister Jayalalithaa, ahead of her birthday on Wednesday.

The 50-year-old staunch supporter of Ms. Jayalalithaa, claims that he had been doing this one day before his leader’s birthday every year since 1997.

For an hour Holding a party flag, Mr. Karuppiah floated in the swimming pool for nearly an hour in the presence of party cadres, including Mayor V.V. Rajan Chellappa, who is also the party’s rural district secretary. “Since the leaders had other tasks at hand, I had to give up within an hour,” he said.

Jalapradakshanam was a means to invoke the blessings of the elements of earth, water and sky.

“Any prayer made at such a situation would be answered. I sought long life for Amma,” Mr. Karuppiah said.

Mr. Karuppiah rose in his political career to become an MLA from a humble beginning of having served as the All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam branch secretary of Vavidamaruthur.
title: MLA floats in water for Chief Minister’s long life
